intro: Albuca alba, commonly known as the white albuca, is a bulbous perennial plant native to South Africa. It features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces clusters of white, bell-shaped flowers during the summer months. The plant is adapted to arid environments and requires well-drained soil to thrive. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ease of care. Albuca alba is also valued in traditional medicine for its potential health benefits.
